<A NAME="eolPage196"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	Exhibit A: Compensation upon Termination of Employment
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Exhibit is attached to, and constitutes a part of, that certain offer of employment dated August&nbsp;5, 2016, between USA Waste-Management Resources,
	LLC, a limited liability company organized under the laws of New York (the &#147;Company&#148;) for and on behalf of its affiliated entities (together with the Company, collectively referred to as the &#147;Company Group&#148;) and Charles Boettcher
	(&#147;Executive&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Definitions.
</B>
	The following terms used in this Exhibit shall have the following meanings:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;Base Salary&#148;
</B>
	means Executive&#146;s annual rate of base salary in effect immediately prior to the Termination Date (or, in
	the event of Executive&#146;s resignation for Good Reason, the annual rate of base salary in effect immediately prior to the event giving rise to Good Reason if such annual base salary is higher than the annual base salary in effect immediately
	prior to the Termination Date).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;Board&#148;
</B>
	means the Board of Directors of WMI.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;Cause&#148;
</B>
	means Executive&#146;s (a)&nbsp;willful or deliberate and continual refusal to perform Executive&#146;s employment
	duties reasonably requested by the Company Group after receipt of written notice to Executive of such failure to perform, specifying such failure (other than as a result of Executive&#146;s sickness, illness or injury) and failure to cure such
	nonperformance within ten (10)&nbsp;days of receipt of said written notice; (b)&nbsp;breach of any statutory or common law duty of loyalty to any member of the Company Group; (c)&nbsp;conviction of, or plea of nolo contendre to, any felony or crime
	involving fraud, dishonesty, or moral turpitude; (d)&nbsp;willful or intentional cause of material injury to the Company Group, its property, or its assets; (e)&nbsp;disclosure or attempted disclosure to any unauthorized person(s) of the Company
	Group&#146;s proprietary or confidential information; (f)&nbsp;material violation or a repeated and willful violation of the Company Group&#146;s policies or procedures, including but not limited to, any applicable Company Group Code of Business
	Conduct and Ethics (or any successor policy) then in effect; or (g)&nbsp;breach of any of the covenants set forth in the Loyalty Agreement or any subsequent agreement of similar purpose.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;Change in Control&#148;
</B>
	means the first to occur on or after the date on which you commence employment, the occurrence of any of
	the following events:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a) any Person, or Persons acting as a group (within the meaning of Section 409A of the Internal
	Revenue Code), directly or indirectly, including by purchases, mergers, consolidation or otherwise, acquires ownership of securities of WMI that, together with stock held by such Person or Persons, represents fifty percent (50%) or more of the total
	voting power or total fair market value of WMI&#146;s then outstanding securities;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b) any Person, or Persons acting as a
	group (within the meaning of Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code), acquires, (or has acquired during the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period ending on the date of the most recent acquisition by such Person or Persons)
	directly or indirectly, including by purchases, merger, consolidation or otherwise, ownership of the securities of WMI that represent thirty percent (30%) or more of the total voting power of WMI&#146;s then outstanding voting securities;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	A-1
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage197"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c) the following individuals cease for any reason to constitute a majority of
	the number of directors then serving during any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period: individuals who, at the beginning of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period, constitute the Board and any new director
	(other than a director whose initial assumption of office is in connection with an actual or threatened election contest, including but not limited to a consent solicitation, relating or the election of directors of WMI) whose appointment or
	election by the Board or nomination for election by WMI&#146;s stockholders was approved or recommended by a vote of at least a majority of the directors before the date of such appointment or election or whose appointment, election or nomination
	for election was previously so approved or recommended;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(d) a Person or Persons acting as a group acquires (or has
	acquired during the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period ending on the date of the most recent acquisition by such Person or Persons) assets from WMI that have a total gross fair market value equal to or more than forty percent
	(40%) of the total gross fair market value of all of the assets of WMI immediately before such acquisition or acquisitions, other than a sale or disposition by WMI of such assets to an entity, at least fifty percent (50%) of the combined voting
	power of the voting securities of which are owned by WMI or by the stockholders of WMI in substantially the same proportions as their ownership of WMI immediately prior to such sale.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;Change in Control Termination
</B>
	&#148; means a Qualifying Termination of Employment that occurs during the period commencing on the
	date occurring six months immediately prior to the date on which a Change in Control occurs and ending on the second anniversary of the date on which a Change in Control occurs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;COBRA&#148;
</B>
	means the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985, as amended from time to time, and the regulations
	promulgated thereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;Code&#148;
</B>
	means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended from time to time, and the regulations
	promulgated thereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;Disability&#148;
</B>
	means Executive has become physically or mentally disabled so as to render Executive
	incapable of performing the essential functions of his position (with or without reasonable accommodations) and such disability is expected to result in death or to last for a continuous period of at least twelve (12)&nbsp;months, provided that such
	condition constitutes a &#147;disability&#148; within the meaning of Section 409A of the Code. Executive&#146;s receipt of disability benefits under the Company&#146;s long-term disability plan or receipt of Social Security disability benefits shall
	be deemed conclusive evidence of Disability for purpose of this Exhibit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#147;
<B>
	Exchange Act
</B>
	&#148; means the Securities and Exchange
	Act of 1934, as amended from time to time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;Good Reason&#148;
</B>
	means the occurrence of any of the following events or
	conditions without Executive&#146;s express written consent: (a)&nbsp;a material diminution in Executive&#146;s Base Salary (excluding a reduction in compensation similarly affecting all or substantially all of WMI&#146;s executive officers); (b)
	the Company Group materially diminishes Executive&#146;s core duties
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	A-2
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage198"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	or responsibility for those core duties, so as to effectively cause Executive to no longer be performing the duties of his position (except in each case in connection with the termination of
	Executive&#146;s employment for death, Disability, or Cause, or temporarily as a result of Executive&#146;s illness or other absence); (c) in the event of WMI becoming a fifty percent or more subsidiary of any other entity, the Company Group
	materially diminishes the duties, authority or responsibilities of the person to whom Executive is required to report; resulting in a material negative change in the employment relationship, or (d)&nbsp;the failure of the Company to obtain the
	assumption of the terms set forth herein by any successors as contemplated in Paragraph 11(c) below;
<U>
	provided
</U>
	that, Executive must notify WMI&#146;s Chief Executive Officer in writing of his or her intention to terminate his or her
	employment;
<U>
	provided
</U>
	,
<U>
	further
</U>
	, that (i)&nbsp;such notice shall be provided to WMI&#146;s Chief Executive Officer within ninety (90)&nbsp;calendar days of the initial existence of such event, (ii)&nbsp;the Company shall have thirty
	(30)&nbsp;calendar days to cure such event after receipt of such notice, and (iii)&nbsp;if uncured, Executive shall terminate his or her employment within six months following the initial existence of such event.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;Loyalty Agreement&#148;
</B>
	means that certain Loyalty and Confidentiality Agreement attached as Exhibit B to the offer letter to
	which this Exhibit A has been attached, which agreement is being entered into concurrently herewith as a condition of and inducement to the Company&#146;s willingness to provide the benefits set forth in this Exhibit A.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#147;
<B>
	Person
</B>
	&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in Section 3(a)(9) of the Exchange Act, as modified and used in Sections 13(d) and
	14(d) thereof, except that such term shall not include (a)&nbsp;WMI; (b) a trustee or other fiduciary holding securities under an employee benefit plan of the Company Group; (c)&nbsp;an employee benefit plan of any member of the Company Group;
	(d)&nbsp;an underwriter temporarily holding securities pursuant to an offering of such securities or (e)&nbsp;an entity owned, directly or indirectly, by the stockholders of the Company in substantially the same proportions as their ownership of
	shares of common stock of WMI.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;Qualifying Termination of Employment&#148;
</B>
	means a termination of Executive&#146;s employment
	by the Company Group for reasons other than the following: (a)&nbsp;a termination of employment for Cause; (b)&nbsp;Executive&#146;s resignation for any reason other than due to Good Reason; (c)&nbsp;the cessation of Executive&#146;s employment with
	the Company Group due to death or Disability; or (d)&nbsp;the cessation of Executive&#146;s employment with the Company Group as the result of the sale,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	spin-off
</FONT>
	or other divestiture of a division, business
	unit or subsidiary or a merger or other business combination, if either (i)&nbsp;Executive becomes employed with the purchaser or successor in interest to Executive&#146;s employer with regard to such division, business unit or subsidiary, or
	(ii)&nbsp;Executive is offered employment by such purchaser or successor in interest, in each of cases (i)&nbsp;or (ii), on terms and conditions comparable in the aggregate (as determined by the Compensation Committee of the Board in its sole
	discretion) to the terms and conditions of Executive&#146;s employment with the Company Group immediately prior to such transaction.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;Severance Benefits&#148;
</B>
	means the benefits payable to Executive pursuant hereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;Termination Date&#148;
</B>
	means the date on which Executive&#146;s employment with the Company Group terminates due to a Qualifying
	Termination of Employment, death or Disability. For all purposes hereof, Executive shall be considered to have terminated employment with the Company Group when he or she incurs a &#147;separation of service&#148; with the Company within the meaning
	of Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(A)(i) of the Code and the applicable guidance issued thereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	A-3
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage199"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	&#147;WMI
</B>
	&#148; means Waste Management, Inc., a Delaware corporation and member of the
	Company Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Effect of Termination of Employment on Compensation and Accrued Rights.
</B>
	Upon termination of Executive&#146;s employment with the Company Group for any reason, all compensation and all benefits to Executive shall
	terminate,
<U>
	provided
</U>
	that the Company shall pay Executive: (a)&nbsp;the earned but unpaid portion of Executive&#146;s Base Salary through the Termination Date; and (b)&nbsp;any unpaid expense or other reimbursements due to Executive
	(collectively, the &#147;Accrued Rights&#148;).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Payments and Benefits upon Qualifying Termination of Employment.
</B>
	Subject to Paragraphs 5 through 7, upon Executive&#146;s Qualifying Termination of Employment and provided that Executive has been and remains in
	compliance with any and all restrictive covenants and other obligations under any agreement with any member of the Company Group, including, without limitation, the Loyalty Agreement, then Executive shall be entitled to receive the Severance
	Benefits described in this Paragraph 3, in addition to the Accrued Rights.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Cash Severance.
</B>
	Executive shall be entitled to receive cash severance payments in an aggregate amount equal to two times the sum of (i)&nbsp;Executive&#146;s Base Salary and (ii)&nbsp;Executive&#146;s target
	annual bonus amount as of the Termination Date. Fifty percent (50%) of such amount shall be paid in a lump sum no later than 74 days following the Termination Date. The remaining fifty percent (50%) shall be paid in substantially equal installments
	in accordance with the Company&#146;s normal payroll practices over the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	two-year
</FONT>
	period following the Executive&#146;s Termination Date;
<U>
	provided
</U>
	, that any installments that would otherwise have been
	paid during the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	60-day
</FONT>
	period following the Termination Date shall instead be accumulated and paid on the first regular payroll date that occurs after the
	60
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day following termination.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Bonus for Year of Termination.
</B>
	Executive shall be entitled to receive (i)&nbsp;to the extent earned but not yet paid, Executive&#146;s annual bonus for the year preceding the year in which the Termination Date
	occurs in an amount determined by the Company and subject to the terms and conditions of the Company Group&#146;s annual bonus program as then in effect, and (ii)&nbsp;a prorated annual bonus for the year in which the Termination Date occurs,
	calculated based upon (x)&nbsp;in the event such Qualifying Termination of Employment is
<U>
	not
</U>
	a Change in Control Termination, actual performance under the terms of the applicable Company Group annual bonus program as then in effect or
	(y)&nbsp;in the event such Qualifying Termination of Employment is a Change in Control Termination, based upon attainment of 100% of the maximum bonus available to Executive under the terms of the applicable Company Group annual bonus program then
	in effect. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event that Executive becomes eligible for a bonus pursuant to subparagraph (b)(ii)(y) after having already received a bonus payment pursuant to subparagraph (b)(ii)(x), such previously-paid amount
	shall be deducted from
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	A-4
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage200"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	any amount owed pursuant to subparagraph (b)(ii)(y). Any bonus provided for under subparagraph (b)(ii)(x) shall&nbsp;be paid at the same time bonuses are paid by the Company Group to other
	participants in such program (but in no event later than the March&nbsp;15th occurring immediately following the year in which the Termination Date occurs), subject to the terms and conditions of the Company Group&#146;s annual bonus program as then
	in effect. Any bonus provided for under subparagraph (b)(ii)(y) shall be payable within seventy-four (74)&nbsp;days after the later of the Termination Date or the date of the Change in Control. Any bonus payable pursuant to subparagraph (b)(ii)(x)
	or (b)(ii)(y) shall be prorated to reflect the number of calendar days out of 365 (or 366, in the event the Termination Date occurs during a leap year) during which Executive was employed by Company Group during the year of the Qualifying
	Termination of Employment, including the Termination Date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Continued Benefits Coverage.
</B>
	Provided that Executive (and/or his or her dependents) timely elects COBRA coverage, the Company shall pay to Executive (or to Executive&#146;s family in the event of Executive&#146;s
	death) on a monthly basis an amount equal to the monthly amount of the COBRA continuation coverage premium for such month, at the same level and cost to Executive (or Executive&#146;s dependents in the event of his or her death) as immediately
	preceding the Termination Date, under the relevant Company Group medical plan in which Executive participated immediately preceding the Termination Date, less the amount of Executive&#146;s portion of such monthly premium as in effect immediately
	preceding the Termination Date, until the earlier of (i)&nbsp;18 months after the Termination Date or (ii)&nbsp;the date on which Executive and Executive&#146;s dependents have become eligible for substantially similar healthcare coverage or become
	entitled to Medicare coverage . The executive acknowledges that any payments under this subparagraph (c)&nbsp;shall constitute taxable income to Executive.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Effect of Termination due to Executive&#146;s Disability.
</B>
	Subject to Paragraphs 5 through 7, upon termination of Executive&#146;s employment due to Disability and provided that Executive has been and remains in
	compliance with any and all restrictive covenants and other obligations under any agreement with the any member of the Company Group, including, without limitation, Loyalty Agreement, then Executive shall be entitled to receive the in addition to
	the Accrued Rights, the following: (i)&nbsp;to the extent earned but not yet paid, Executive&#146;s annual bonus for the year preceding the year in which the Termination Date occurs in an amount determined by the Company Group and subject to the
	terms and conditions of the Company Group&#146;s annual bonus program as then in effect, and (ii)&nbsp;a prorated annual bonus for the year in which the Termination Date occurs, determined based upon actual performance under the terms of the Company
	Group&#146;s annual bonus program as then in effect, with the bonus provided for in this subparagraph (b)&nbsp;to be paid at the same time bonuses are paid by the Company Group to other participants in such program (but in no event later than the
	March&nbsp;15th occurring immediately following the year in which the Termination Date occurs), subject to the terms and conditions of the Company Group&#146;s annual bonus program as then in effect and prorated to reflect the number of calendar
	days out of 365 (or 366, in the event the Termination Date occurs during a leap year) during which Executive was employed by Company Group during the year of the Qualifying Termination of Employment, including the Termination Date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	A-5
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage201"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Potential Limitation on Severance Benefits:
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
<B>
	Maximum Severance Amount.
</B>
	Notwithstanding any provision in this Exhibit to the contrary, in the event that in connection with a Qualifying Termination of Employment it is determined by the Company that the Severance Benefits would exceed 2.99 times the sum of
	Executive&#146;s then current base salary and target bonus (the &#147;Maximum Severance Amount&#148;), then the aggregate present value of the Severance Benefits provided to Executive shall be reduced by the Company to the Reduced Amount. The
	&#147;Reduced Amount&#148; shall be an amount, expressed in present value, that maximizes the aggregate present value of the Severance Benefits without exceeding the Maximum Severance Amount.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(b) Severance Benefits.
</B>
	For purposes of determining Severance Benefits under Paragraph 5(a) above, Severance Benefits means the present
	value of payments or distributions by the Company Group to or for the benefit of Executive (whether paid or provided pursuant to the terms of this Exhibit or otherwise)
<B>
	,
</B>
	and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(A) including: (i)&nbsp;cash amounts payable by the Company in the event of termination of Executive&#146;s employment; and
	(ii)&nbsp;the present value of benefits or perquisites provided for periods after termination of employment (but excluding benefits or perquisites provided to employees generally); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(B) excluding: (i)&nbsp;payments of salary, bonus or performance award amounts that had accrued at the time of termination;
	(ii)&nbsp;payments based on accrued qualified and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-qualified
</FONT>
	deferred compensation plans, including retirement and savings benefits; (iii)&nbsp;any benefits or perquisites provided under plans or programs
	applicable to employees generally; (iv)&nbsp;amounts paid as part of any agreement intended to &#147;make-whole&#148; any forfeiture of benefits from a prior employer; (v)&nbsp;amounts paid for services following termination of employment for a
	reasonable consulting agreement for a period not to exceed one year; (vi)&nbsp;amounts paid for post-termination covenants (such as a covenant not to compete); (vii) the value of accelerated vesting or payment of any outstanding equity-based award;
	and (viii)&nbsp;any payment that the Board or any committee thereof determines in good faith to be a reasonable settlement of any claim made against the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(c) Golden Parachute Provisions.
</B>
	Following application of Paragraph 5(a), in the event that the payment of the remaining Severance
	Benefits to Executive plus any other payments to Executive which would be subject to Section 280G of the Code (including any reduced Severance Benefits) (&#147;280G Severance Benefits&#148;) would be subject (in whole or part), to any excise tax
	imposed under Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code (the &#147;Excise Tax&#148;), then the cash portion of the 280G Severance Benefits shall first be further reduced, and the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	280G Severance Benefits shall
	thereafter be further reduced, to the extent necessary so that no portion of the 280G Severance Benefits is subject to the Excise Tax, but only if (i)&nbsp;the
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	A-6
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage202"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	amount of the 280G Severance Benefits to be received by Executive, as so reduced by this Section 22(c) and after subtracting the amount of federal, state and local income taxes on such reduced
	280G Severance Benefits (after taking into account the phase out of itemized deductions and personal exemptions attributable to such reduced 280G Severance Benefits) is greater than or equal to (ii)&nbsp;the amount of the 280G Severance Benefits to
	be received by Executive without such reduction by this Section 22(c) after subtracting the amount of federal, state and local income taxes on such 280G Severance Benefits and the amount of the Excise Tax to which Executive would be subject in
	respect of such unreduced 280G Severance Benefits (after taking into account the phase out of itemized deductions and personal exemptions attributable to such unreduced 280G Severance Benefits). For purposes of determining the 280G Severance
	Benefits, (i)&nbsp;no portion of the 280G Severance Benefits, the receipt or enjoyment of which Executive shall have waived at such time and in such manner as not to constitute a &#147;payment&#148; within the meaning of 280G(b) of the Code, shall
	be taken into account, (ii)&nbsp;no portion of the 280G Severance Benefits shall be taken into account which, in the opinion of tax counsel (&#147;Tax Counsel&#148;) who is reasonably acceptable to Executive and selected by the accounting firm (the
	&#147;Auditor&#148;) which was, immediately prior to the change in control, the Company&#146;s independent auditor, does not constitute a &#147;parachute payment&#148; within the meaning of Section 280G(b)(2) of the Code (including by reason of
	Section 280G(b)(4)(A)) of the Code; (iii)&nbsp;no portion of the 280G Severance Benefits shall be taken into account which, in the opinion of Tax Counsel, constitutes reasonable compensation for services actually rendered, within the meaning of
	Section 280G(b)(4)(B) of the Code, in excess of the &#147;base amount&#148; (as defined in Internal Revenue Section 280G(b)(3) of the Code) allocable to such reasonable compensation, and (iv)&nbsp;the value of any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	benefit or any deferred payment or benefit included in the 280G Severance Benefits shall be determined by the Auditor in accordance with the principles of Sections 280G(d)(3) and (4)&nbsp;of the Code.
	For purposes of this subparagraph (c), the present value of Severance Benefits and 280G Severance Benefits shall be determined in accordance with Section 280G(d)(4) of the Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	6.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Requirement of General Release.
</B>
	Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, the payments and benefits under Paragraph&nbsp;3 or Paragraph 4, as applicable, shall only be payable if Executive executes and
	delivers to the Company, and does not revoke, a general release and waiver agreement in a form acceptable to the Company, which includes a release of all claims or causes of action against or with respect to any and all members of the Company Group
	and their respective subsidiaries, affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents, benefit plans, fiduciaries and their insurers, successors, and assigns (excluding any claim for indemnity under this Exhibit, any claim under state workers&#146;
	compensation or unemployment laws, or any claim under COBRA), provided that such general release and waiver agreement is returned, and not revoked, by Executive within the time period specified in the agreement (which shall not exceed sixty
	(60)&nbsp;calendar days after the Termination Date). In the event Executive does not execute or revokes the release agreement in the time provided for therein, Executive shall not be entitled to payment of any benefits other than the Accrued Rights.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	7.

<B>
	Suspension and Recoupment of Termination Benefits for Subsequently Discovered Cause.
</B>
	Notwithstanding any
	provision of this Exhibit to the contrary, if within one (1)&nbsp;year of Executive&#146;s Termination Date for any reason other than for Cause, it is determined by the
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<A NAME="eolPage203"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Company that Executive could have been terminated for Cause, then to the extent permitted by law: (a)&nbsp;the Company may elect to cancel any and all payments of any benefits otherwise due
	Executive, but not yet paid, under this Exhibit or otherwise; and (b)&nbsp;upon written demand by the Company, Executive shall refund to the Company any amounts, plus interest, previously paid by Company to Executive pursuant to Paragraphs 3 or 4,
	less one thousand dollars ($1,000) which Executive shall be entitled to retain as fully sufficient consideration to support and maintain in effect any contractual obligations that Executive has to the Company prior to the refund, including the
	Release as defined herein.

</B>

<B>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-duplication
</FONT>
	of Benefits.
</B>
	The Company may, in its discretion and to the extent permitted under applicable law, offset against Executive&#146;s Severance Benefits
	hereunder or any other severance, termination, or similar benefits payable to Executive by the Company, including, but not limited to any amounts paid under any employment agreement or other individual contractual arrangement, or amounts paid to
	comply with, or satisfy liability under, the Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act or any other federal, state, or local law requiring payments in connection with an involuntary termination of employment, plant shutdown, or workforce
	reduction, including, but not limited to, amounts paid in connection with paid leaves of absence, back pay, benefits, and other payments intended to satisfy such liability or alleged liability.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&nbsp;

</B>
	The Company may recover any overpayment of Severance Benefits made to Executive or Executive&#146;s estate hereunder or, to the extent permitted by applicable law, offset any overpayment of Severance
	Benefits or any other amounts due from Executive against any Severance Benefits or other amount the Company owes Executive or Executive&#146;s estate.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

	No Mitigation.
</B>
	In no event shall Executive be obligated to seek other employment or take any other action by way of mitigation of the amounts payable to Executive under any of the provisions hereof and such
	amounts shall not be reduced whether or not Executive obtains other employment.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<B>
</B>
	The payments provided hereunder are intended to meet the requirements of Section 409A of the Code, and
	shall be interpreted and construed consistent with that intent. The payments to Executive hereunder are intended to be exempt from Section 409A of the Code to the maximum extent possible, under either the separation pay exemption pursuant to
	Treasury regulation
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	&#167;1.409A-1(b)(9)(iii)
</FONT>
	or as short-term deferrals pursuant to Treasury regulation
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	&#167;1.409A-1(b)(4),
</FONT>
	and each payment hereunder is designated
	as a separate payment for such purposes. For purposes of Section 409A of the Code and the regulations and other guidance thereunder and any state law of similar effect (including without limitation Treasury Regulations Section
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	1.409A-2(b)(2)(iii)),
</FONT>
	all payments made under this
<U>
	Exhibit
</U>
	(whether severance payments or otherwise) will be treated as a right to receive a series of separate payments and, accordingly, each installment
	payment under
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	A-8

<A NAME="eolPage204"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	this
<U>
	Exhibit
</U>
	will at all times be considered a separate and distinct payment. In the event that the Company determines that any provision hereof does not comply with Section&nbsp;409A of
	the Code or any rules, regulations or guidance promulgated thereunder and that as a result Executive may become subject to a Section&nbsp;409A tax, notwithstanding Paragraph 11(e), the Company shall have the discretion to amend or modify such
	provision to avoid the application of such Section&nbsp;409A tax, and in no event shall Executive&#146;s consent be required for such amendment or modification. Notwithstanding any provision hereof to the contrary, Executive shall be solely
	responsible and liable for the satisfaction of all taxes and penalties that may arise in connection with amounts payable pursuant hereto (including any taxes arising under Section&nbsp;409A of the Code), and the Company shall have no obligation to
	indemnify or otherwise hold Executive harmless from any or all of such taxes.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	Notwithstanding any other provision hereof, to the extent any payments (including the provision of benefits) hereunder constitute &#147;nonqualified deferred compensation,&#148; within the meaning of
	Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, solely to the extent necessary to avoid the payment of additional taxes pursuant to Section 409A of the Code, the payment shall be paid (or provided) in accordance with the following:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If Executive is a &#147;specified employee&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i) of the Code on Executive&#146;s Termination Date, then no such payment that constitutes &#147;nonqualified deferred
	compensation&#148; shall be made during the period beginning on the Termination Date and ending on the date that is six months following the Termination Date or, if earlier, on the date of Executive&#146;s death, if the earlier making of such
	payment would result in tax penalties being imposed on Executive under Section&nbsp;409A of the Code. The amount of any payment that would otherwise be paid to Executive during this period shall instead be paid, with interest at the short-term
	applicable federal rate as in effect as of the Termination Date, to Executive on the first business day following the date that is six months following the Termination Date or, if earlier, the date of Executive&#146;s death.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the period during which Executive may execute the general release and waiver agreement as contemplated by Paragraph 6 commences in one calendar year and ends in a subsequent calendar year, such amounts or benefits
	shall be paid or provided in the subsequent calendar year in accordance with Section&nbsp;409A of the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	another arrangement with respect to Executive, such payments hereunder will be made at the same time(s) and in the same form(s) as such amounts would have been payable under the other arrangement, to the extent required to comply with
	Section&nbsp;409A of the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	(iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Payments with respect to reimbursements of all expenses pursuant hereto shall be made promptly, but in any event on or before the last day of the calendar year following the calendar year in which the relevant expense
	is incurred. The amount of expenses eligible for reimbursement, or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	in-kind
</FONT>
	benefit provided, during a calendar year may not affect the expenses eligible for reimbursement, or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	in-kind
</FONT>
	benefit to be provided, in any other calendar year and Executive&#146;s right to such reimbursement or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	in-kind
</FONT>
	benefits may not be liquidated or exchanged for
	any other benefit.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	To the extent that any post-termination continuation of health or medical coverage pursuant to this Exhibit would violate either Section 105(h) of the Code or the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act of 2010
	(collectively, &#147;PPACA&#148;) and related regulations and guidance promulgated thereunder, the Company may reform this Exhibit in such manner as is reasonably necessary to provide the intended benefit hereunder in a manner that complies with the
	PPACA.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	10.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Dispute Resolution.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Arbitration
</B>
	. The parties agree that any dispute relating to this Exhibit, or to the breach of this Exhibit, arising between Executive and the Company shall be settled by arbitration in accordance with the Federal
	Arbitration Act and the commercial arbitration rules of the American Arbitration Association (&#147;AAA&#148;), or any other mutually agreed upon arbitration service; provided, however, that temporary and preliminary injunctive relief to enforce the
	Loyalty Agreement, and related expedited discovery, may be pursued in a court of law to provide temporary injunctive relief pending a final determination of all issues of final relief through arbitration. The arbitration proceeding, including the
	rendering of an award, shall take place in Houston, Texas, and shall be administered by the AAA (or any other mutually agreed upon arbitration service). The arbitrator shall be jointly selected by the Company and Executive within thirty
	(30)&nbsp;days of the notice of dispute, or if the parties cannot agree, in accordance with the commercial arbitration rules of the AAA (or any other mutually agreed upon arbitration service). All fees and expenses associated with the arbitration
	shall be borne equally by Executive and the Company during the arbitration, pending final decision by the arbitrator as to who should bear fees, unless otherwise ordered by the arbitrator. The arbitrator shall not be authorized to create a cause of
	action or remedy not recognized by applicable state or federal law. The arbitrator shall be authorized to award final injunctive relief. The award of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon the parties without appeal or review, except as
	permitted by the arbitration laws of the State of Texas. The award, inclusive of any and all injunctive relief provided for therein, shall be enforceable through a court of law upon motion of either party.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<B>
	Governing Law and Venue.
</B>
	This Exhibit shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of
	the State of Texas applicable to agreements made and to be performed in that State, without regard to its conflict of laws provisions. The
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	parties agree that any legal action arising from this Exhibit that is not required to be resolved through arbitration pursuant to Paragraph 10(a) must be pursued in a court of competent
	jurisdiction that is located in Houston, Texas.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&nbsp;

	Company will require any successor (whether direct or indirect, by purchase, merger, consolidation, share exchange or otherwise) to all or substantially all of the business and/or assets of the Company Group to assume expressly and agree to perform
	the Company&#146;s obligations under this Exhibit in the same manner and to the same extent that the Company would be required to perform such obligations if no such succession had taken place. For purposes of this Exhibit, the term &#147;the
	Company Group&#148; means the Company Group as hereinbefore defined and any successor to its business and/or assets as aforesaid which assumes and agrees to perform such obligations under this Exhibit by operation of law, or otherwise.
